results.name: default/mysql

error.Text: Service has not ready endpoints, pods: [Pod/mysql-5548b86849-8ftbw], expected 1

results.details:
Error: The service has no ready endpoints because the specified pod is not ready.  
Solution: 1. Check pod status with `kubectl get pods`. 2. Inspect pod details using `kubectl describe pod mysql-5548b86849-8ftbw`. 3. Look for readiness probe issues. 4. Fix any configuration errors. 5. Restart the pod if necessary.

results.name: default/wordpress

error.Text: Service has not ready endpoints, pods: [Pod/wordpress-6977f9d744-xbrn6], expected 1

results.details:
Error: The service has no ready endpoints because the expected pod is not in a ready state.

Solution: 
1. Check pod status with `kubectl get pods`.
2. Inspect pod logs using `kubectl logs wordpress-6977f9d744-xbrn6`.
3. Verify readiness probe settings.
4. Ensure network policies allow traffic.
5. Restart pod if needed.

results.name: default/mysql-5548b86849-8ftbw
results.details:
Error: Kubernetes is having trouble pulling the "mysql:latest" image from the container registry.

Solution: 
1. Check internet connectivity.
2. Verify the image name and tag.
3. Ensure Docker Hub is accessible.
4. Check Kubernetes node permissions.
5. Try a specific version tag instead of "latest".

results.name: default/wordpress-6977f9d744-xbrn6
results.details:
Error: Kubernetes is having trouble pulling the "wordpress:latest" image from the container registry.

Solution: 
1. Check internet connectivity.
2. Verify the image name and tag.
3. Ensure Docker Hub is accessible.
4. Check for rate limits on Docker Hub.
5. Try pulling the image manually with `docker pull wordpress:latest`.
